title.string: Chapter 04

The topic of surrogate mothers interested Professor Snyder. Snyder read the available materials on the topic and wanted to develop an age, education, and income profile of women who serve as surrogate mothers in the United States. To develop this profile,

description.string: Discuss the role of exploration, description, and explanation in social research.

title.string: Professor Dooley examined the literature on AIDS and could find nothing that examined children's attitudes toward parents and friends with AIDS. To examine this topic, Dooley should undertake a(n):

description.string: Discuss the role of exploration, description, and explanation in social research.

title.string: If a researcher wanted to know why there was a noticeable increase in the number of burglaries in the town of Southpaw during 2005, the researcher would design a(n):

description.string: Discuss the role of exploration, description, and explanation in social research.

title.string: Ruth puzzles over a report that claims that women are more likely to vote for Democrats than men. She puzzles because her best friend, Joan, always votes Republican. Ruth is guilty of using which of the following false criteria for nomothetic causality?

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

title.string: Which of the following hypotheses best fits the criteria of causality?

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

title.string: Professor King examined all the reasons given by 100 couples for their marriages. In the final research report, King listed all the reasons given by the 200 people for their marriages. Professor King is:

description.string: Discuss the logic and procedures of idiographic explanation.

title.string: A(n) _____ is probabilistic and usually incomplete.

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

title.string: A researcher examined newspaper editorials from papers published in major U.S. cities to determine what issues concerned readers. The unit of analysis in these cases is:

description.string: Identify some of the common units of analysis in social research and explain why that concept is important.

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

title.string: In cases where one variable seems to cause another, yet the relation between the two makes no sense, there is a:

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

description.string: Identify some of the common units of analysis in social research and explain why that concept is important.

description.string: Identify and describe some common study designs based on the time dimension.

title.string: Professor Sheckler is looking to study the career trajectories of a specific group of college students, following the same individuals through their senior year and then five years afterward. What form of research methodology would he be using?

description.string: Identify and describe some common study designs based on the time dimension.

title.string: Tyler finds that in burglary cases male and female jurors are equally likely to vote to acquit. Tyler should conclude that:

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

title.string: Rose is conducting a study where she intends to follow a random selection of teenagers over a five-year period. Each year she will randomly sample 500 individuals from a total of 50 high schools. What form of research is she performing?

description.string: Identify and describe some common study designs based on the time dimension.

title.string: In Sweden, there is a very strong correlation between the number of storks and the number of babies born. However, both of these variables are associated with region (rural vs. urban). This illustrates:

description.string: Name and discuss the legitimate and false criteria for nomothetic explanation.

title.string: Professor Stone designs a study to examine the effect of a teenage pregnancy on the career choices of the teens. Stone interviews a sample of teenage women during their pregnancy, after the birth, and one year later. Stone is using a:

description.string: Identify and describe some common study designs based on the time dimension.

title.string: Research designs are descriptive, explanatory, or exploratory—never more than one.

description.string: Discuss the role of exploration, description, and explanation in social research.

title.string: A research proposal describes what you intend to accomplish and how.

description.string: Describe the elements and structure of a research proposal.

title.string: Researchers ignore previous work on a topic so that their research can be original.

description.string: Give examples of how research design can have ethical implications.

title.string: The ecological fallacy refers to drawing conclusions about individuals based solely on the observation of groups.

description.string: Identify some of the common units of analysis in social research and explain why that concept is important.

title.string: Operationalization is the process of clarifying what is meant by the concepts being used in a study.

title.string: A necessary condition represents a condition that, if it is present, will pretty much guarantee the effect in question.

title.string: The units of analysis and the aggregates that we generalize about are the same.

description.string: Identify some of the common units of analysis in social research and explain why that concept is important.
